titleproper.value:
Guide to the Media Entertainment, Inc. Oral History Collection
            <num>ALBA.074</num>

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace
        <date>2017-08-18T17:10:17</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

unittitle.value: Media Entertainment, Inc. Oral History Collection

abstract.value:
Consists of videos and transcripts for
        eleven interviews conducted in 1996 for the documentary In Search of the Lincoln Brigade
        (c.1999).

p.value:
Materials are open to researchers. Please contact the Tamiment Library & Robert F.
        Wagner Labor Archives for more information and to schedule an appointment,
        tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu or 212-998-2630.

The Abraham Lincoln Brigade were volunteers from the United States that went to Spain to
        fight fascism in the Spanish Civil War. The documentary <emph render="italic">In Search of
          The Lincoln Brigade</emph>, produced by Media Entertainment, Inc., recounts the Spanish
        Civil War through the eyes of eleven Abraham Lincoln Brigade volunteers.

Consists of videos and transcripts for eleven interviews conducted in 1996 for the
        documentary <title render="italic">In Search of the Lincoln Brigade</title> (c.1999). The
        interviewees are: Morris Brier, Ralph Fasanella, Milt Felsen, Harry Fisher, Moe Fishman,
        Leonard Levenson, Abe Smorodin, Bill Sussman, Anthony Toney, Bill Van Felix, and Milt
        Wolff.
